isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - CATERPILLAR - 1992 - 1993 - TROUBLESHOOTING

svcsubsecinfo.para: This section includes Troubleshooting Charts for International installed circuits and components that are part of the Caterpillar electronic engine control system.

To begin the process, refer to the appropriate Caterpillar troubleshooting manual and follow their directions. If the Caterpillar diagnostics indicate that a International circuit is suspect, use the troubleshooting charts included in this section for a step-by-step procedure.
The Pro Link EST with the Caterpillar cartridge can be used to read fault codes, customer and engine parameters, and monitor various switches and sensors.

svcproc.title: IMPORTANT STEPS BEFORE TESTING
svcproc.para: Gather information by talking to the driver if possible. Try to determine the exact symptoms by gathering relevant information:

step2.para: What else occurred at that time?

step1.para: Verify the problem. Is the complaint due to misunderstood customer selected parameters? Use Prolink EST to review customer selected parameters.
Check for and record any logged fault codes.

step2.para: Do the logged codes correlate to probable causes?
Were the codes logged about the same time as the symptoms appeared? Were the codes logged repeatedly?
Are the logged codes related to other symptoms? Do they have a common cause?

step1.para: Avoid Preconceived Ideas! Eliminate any non-electrical causes for the problem first (contaminated fuel, clogged air filters etc.).
